name: Dark Hypno

attacks.name: Bench Manipulation
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a number of coins equal to the number of Pok√©mon on his or her Bench. This attack does 20 damage times the number of tails. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Carries a pendulum with it always. Sometimes appears near less-traveled roads and schools at dusk.

strengths: Psypunch is efficient - 20 damage for 1 energy
Bench Manipulation can deal massive damage against full benches
Opponent flips coins, so their bad luck helps you
weaknesses: Against empty bench, Bench Manipulation does nothing
synergies: Cards that force opponent to bench Pokemon

competitiveHistory: Dark Hypno was a solid but not exceptional card. Psypunch offered good early-game efficiency at 20 damage for one energy. Bench Manipulation could theoretically deal up to 100 damage against a full 5-Pokemon bench if all coins came up tails, but the variance made it unreliable. It saw some play but was outclassed by other Psychic options.

rulings.ruling: Bench Manipulation deals damage based on tails flipped by your opponent. If they have 5 benched Pokemon and flip 5 tails, it deals 100 damage.
If opponent has no benched Pokemon, Bench Manipulation does 0 damage - no coins are flipped.
Bench Manipulation ignores Weakness and Resistance, but still triggers 'when damaged' effects.
